title: Old postcard typefaces
content:
Hi. I’m hoping for some font suggestions to use. I really like the style on the back of these postcards, and hoped for something along the lines. I was thinking of using Blair, however, any others would help.

Thanks in advance for your time.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Picture 39.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907032902/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture%2039.png) | 25.11 KB |
| [Picture 40.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907032902/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture%2040.png) | 26.95 KB |
| [Picture 41.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907032902/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture%2041.png) | 24.03 KB |
| [Picture 43.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907032902/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture%2043.png) | 18.56 KB |
| [Picture 42.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907032902/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture%2042.png) | 27.72 KB |

 [‹ (x) Bird Packaging oblique compact sans - Impact {Jan E}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907032902/http:/www.typophile.com/node/38320 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) W Hotels of New York - Gill Sans {Florian} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907032902/http:/www.typophile.com/node/38317 "Go to next forum topic")
author: insertmoney

comments.content: A few that come to mind are Gotham, AT Sackers Gothic, and Engravers Gothic, which would look similar with some distressing. Might want to look at Landry Gothic over at [http://www.ahleman.com/fonts/fontindex.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907032902/http:/www.ahleman.com/fonts/fontindex.html "http://www.ahleman.com/fonts/fontindex.html").
